news_header: Nordic leaders address organized crime issues at the Nordic Council meeting in Reykjavik.
news_text: Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Störe and Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen highlighted the significant problem of organized crime in the Nordic countries during a meeting in Reykjavik. Störe noted that issues in Sweden are also affecting Norway and emphasized the need for cross-border cooperation among police and judicial systems. He also mentioned the importance of providing equal educational opportunities to young people to prevent their involvement in crime. Frederiksen echoed the seriousness of the situation in Sweden and affirmed collaboration with Sweden to tackle the issue. Finnish Minister Petteri Orpo acknowledged gang crime as a serious concern and supported cooperation between Finnish and Swedish police.
